3rd Annual Winter Bioblitz
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Saturday, December 13, 2025 9:00 am - 11:00 am EST
Where
Crystal River Preserve State Park
State Park Street
Crystal River  FL 34428
Directions
7-Mile Loop Trailhead
Fees
Free.
Description
Naturalists from Citrus County Parks and Recreation & Crystal River State Park will be hosting an annual winter Bioblitz at the Crystal River State Park Preserve. We will be celebrating and documenting our diverse wildlife and ecosystem engineers as we hike along the scenic Seven Mile Trail.
The event is free and you do not need to be tech savvy or a an avid hiker. Our 7 mile trail is beginner friendly. Groups may be split among naturalists to optimize number of species seen. Participants can stay for as long as parks open.
Contact
john.kilmer@floridadep.gov

Programs
Program
Color the Real Florida
Florida has 84 natural communities that are home to a variety of plants and animals. Explore coloring pages for eight of these communities by discovering the plants and animals in each habitat.
Program
Critter Sheets
Critter Sheets are fun ways to learn about Florida's plants and animals and how you can help wildlife in your community. Print or use these images on your device with your favorite coloring app.
Program
Girl Scouts Love State Parks
Check out your all-access-pass to everything you need for your Girl Scouts Love State Parks Virtual Florida Adventure. We have curated a collection of fun activities, park videos and career inspirations just for you.
Program
Junior Ranger Program
The Florida State Parks Junior Ranger Program provides opportunities for young people to learn, serve and share Florida's natural and cultural resources. Participating Florida State Parks are found throughout the state.
Program
Manatee Educational Program
Get an up-close view of manatees in their natural environment, one of Florida’s sparkling springs. Learn about these gentle giants from park staff and volunteers.
Homosassa Springs
Program
Operation Recreation Geotour
The Operation Recreation GeoTour, hosted by Geocaching.com, stretches from Pensacola to Key West and includes some of Florida's award-winning state parks! Visit 20 caches and win the Official Operation Recreation Geocoin.
Program
The Outsiders Club
"The Outsiders Club" is an exciting 30-minute program starring kids who explore Florida State Parks and model ways to pursue a healthier, more active, nature-connected lifestyle, featuring camping, fishing, kayaking and hiking.

September 2025 Cleanup
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Saturday, September 13, 2025 9:00 am - 12:00 pm EDT
Where
Lignumvitae Key Botanical State Park
77200 Overseas Hwy
Islamorada  FL 33036
Directions
Location in park
Fees
Free for participants.
Description
September 2025 - Second Saturday Cleanup (SSC): On the second Saturday of each month, we will have a marine debris cleanup inside the boundaries of our state park. This month we will be cleaning up Shell Key, a protected island usually inaccessible to park visitors. Space is limited to only 10 volunteers and pre-registration is required. The minimum age requirements are 18 years old and up or 13 - 17 years old with a guardian. Please email
Robert.Herald@FloridaDEP.gov
by 1:00 p.m. on September 11, 2025 to signup. Next Steps: Within a few days of sending your signup email, you will receive a confirmation email with additional event information. Precautionary and Needs: All volunteers must be able to enter and exit watercraft onto uneven/wet terrain. All volunteers shall be able to walk on uneven terrain including mangrove roots and rocky coastline. All volunteers must be able to get shoes wet as well as prepare to get fully wet and be able to swim. All volunteers must prepare for mosquitos, biting flies, sunshine, heat, and humidity.
Contact
robert.herald@floridadep.gov

Guided Kayak Tour

When
Sunday, September 14, 2025 9:00 am - 11:00 am EDT
Where
Gamble Rogers Memorial State Recreation Area At Flagler Beach
3100 S Oceanshore Blvd.
Flagler Beach  FL 32164
Directions
Kayak launch
Fees
$45 donation per person includes the rental of a single kayak, tandem kayak or canoe; $20 donation per person if bring own kayak. Cash, exact change, or check only. Proceeds benefit Friends of Gamble Rogers State Park. Park entry fee is separate.
Description
Register now for our two-hour guided kayak tour exploring the beautiful estuary with experienced guides. Enjoy the serenity of being on the water while observing the native flora and fauna in their local habitat. All levels of experience are welcome in this two-hour guided paddle. You can paddle in one of the park's kayaks or bring your own. Paddleboards and inflatable vessels are not allowed due to the multiple oyster beds. Participants will receive a brief demonstration on safety, gear requirements and basic kayaking techniques. Bring bug repellent, water and dress appropriately for the weather. Space is limited to ten people per trip, so please sign up early. Reservations required. Call the park at 386-517-2086 to reserve your spot.
Participation Requirements
Contact
stephanie.york@floridadep.gov

Star Gazing At Eden Gardens State Park
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Friday, September 12, 2025 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm CDT
Where
Eden Gardens State Park
181 Eden Gardens Road
Santa Rosa Beach  FL 32459
Directions
Lawn on the North side of the historic Wesley House
Fees
Participation in the star gazing event is free with paid park admission of $4.00 per vehicle, $2.00 per bicyclist or pedestrian. This is an honor park, place your admission fee in the honor box at the entrance or utilize the available QR code.
Description
Join the members of the Northwest Florida Astronomy Association and view the beauty of the universe. We start by setting up just before the sun sets to allow our guest observers to view the equipment and get photos before it gets dark. Once the sun sets, we transition to night time observing. Different size and design telescopes will be set up by dusk and celestial objects will be chosen with an eye to visual observation and variety. The objects visible will depend on the season and time of night but normally include bright galaxies and nebulae, star clusters, and planets. There are a couple of rules that need to be followed so everyone enjoys the event: Please do not touch the telescopes; an errant bump will cause a delay while the object being observed is brought back into view. This is a family event and children are welcome, but since telescopes are by design somewhat delicate and may be expensive, parental control is necessary. For everyone's safety and to minimize the effect on night vision, please, no flash photography. If you want a photo of the equipment please come early enough to get an image before dark. If you bring a flashlight, please use a red filter. While there will be plenty of telescopes available to view through, we invite you to bring your own telescopes/binoculars and join in the fun. Make sure you stop by the welcome table and pick up a free Sky Map.
Contact
clayton.ironwolf@floridadep.gov

Crystal River Bioblitz Walk
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Saturday, September 27, 2025 9:00 am - 12:00 pm EDT
Where
Crystal River Preserve State Park
State Park Street
Crystal River  FL 34428
Directions
Seven Mile Loop Trailhead
Fees
Free
Description
Crystal River Preserve State Park and St. Martins Marsh Aquatic Preserve will be hosting a wildlife walk on the 7-Mile Loop Trail at the end of State Park Street, Crystal River. Participants will take photos and sound recordings to document as many species as they can with the citizen science app, iNaturalist. This event is part of a week long project to observe biodiversity from the saltmarsh of our estuaries to the springs of Kings Bay! Visit the area during the BioBlitz and upload observations to add them to our communal efforts to record as many species as we can! Sign up for a how-to and/or to join the walk here:
https://forms.gle/xS5gGA639Fe3MJLa7

john.kilmer@floridadep.gov

Where
Stephen Foster Folk Culture Center State Park
11016 Lillian Saunders Drive
White Springs  FL 32096
Directions
Stephen Foster Folk Culture Center State Park - various buildings throughout the park
Fees
Registration for the three-day event is $210.00 (add $15 after August 31) which includes all workshops, jam sessions, discussion groups, and concerts.
Description
Stephen Foster Folk Culture Center State Park will host the 17th Annual Stephen Foster Old-Time Music Weekend on the banks of the historic Suwannee River. This three-day event offers participants in-depth instruction in old time music techniques on the banjo, guitar, and fiddle for all levels. Instructors include Paul Brown, Ashlee Watkins, Andrew Small, Beverly Smith, Buz Sibley, Michael Godwin, Phil Levy, Sarah Carleton, Kevin Moran, Mary Allgire, and Chuck Levy.
Contact
andrea.thomas@floridadep.gov

Turtle Talk: A Sea Turtle's Journey
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Friday, September 12, 2025 10:00 am - 11:00 am EDT
Where
Gamble Rogers Memorial State Recreation Area At Flagler Beach
3100 S Oceanshore Blvd.
Flagler Beach  FL 32164
Directions
Beachside pavilion
Fees
Regular park entrance fee applies: $5.00 per vehicle — limit 2-8 people per vehicle $4.00 per single-occupant vehicle $2.00 per pedestrians, bicyclists, extra passengers, passengers in vehicle with holder of Annual Individual Entrance Pass.
Description
Participants will learn about the important role sea turtles play in "the Real Florida" and how your actions can help preserve these majestic turtles for generations to come. All ages are welcome, minors must be accompanied by an adult.
Participation Requirements
Contact
stephanie.york@floridadep.gov

Programs
Program
Color the Real Florida
Florida has 84 natural communities that are home to a variety of plants and animals. Explore coloring pages for eight of these communities by discovering the plants and animals in each habitat.
Program
Critter Sheets
Critter Sheets are fun ways to learn about Florida's plants and animals and how you can help wildlife in your community. Print or use these images on your device with your favorite coloring app.
Program
Girl Scouts Love State Parks
Check out your all-access-pass to everything you need for your Girl Scouts Love State Parks Virtual Florida Adventure. We have curated a collection of fun activities, park videos and career inspirations just for you.
Program
Junior Ranger Program
The Florida State Parks Junior Ranger Program provides opportunities for young people to learn, serve and share Florida's natural and cultural resources. Participating Florida State Parks are found throughout the state.
Program
Manatee Educational Program
Get an up-close view of manatees in their natural environment, one of Florida’s sparkling springs. Learn about these gentle giants from park staff and volunteers.
Homosassa Springs
Program
Operation Recreation Geotour
The Operation Recreation GeoTour, hosted by Geocaching.com, stretches from Pensacola to Key West and includes some of Florida's award-winning state parks! Visit 20 caches and win the Official Operation Recreation Geocoin.
Program
The Outsiders Club
"The Outsiders Club" is an exciting 30-minute program starring kids who explore Florida State Parks and model ways to pursue a healthier, more active, nature-connected lifestyle, featuring camping, fishing, kayaking and hiking.

Programs
Program
Color the Real Florida
Florida has 84 natural communities that are home to a variety of plants and animals. Explore coloring pages for eight of these communities by discovering the plants and animals in each habitat.
Program
Critter Sheets
Critter Sheets are fun ways to learn about Florida's plants and animals and how you can help wildlife in your community. Print or use these images on your device with your favorite coloring app.
Program
Girl Scouts Love State Parks
Check out your all-access-pass to everything you need for your Girl Scouts Love State Parks Virtual Florida Adventure. We have curated a collection of fun activities, park videos and career inspirations just for you.
Program
Junior Ranger Program
The Florida State Parks Junior Ranger Program provides opportunities for young people to learn, serve and share Florida's natural and cultural resources. Participating Florida State Parks are found throughout the state.
Program
Manatee Educational Program
Get an up-close view of manatees in their natural environment, one of Florida’s sparkling springs. Learn about these gentle giants from park staff and volunteers.
Homosassa Springs
Program
Operation Recreation Geotour
The Operation Recreation GeoTour, hosted by Geocaching.com, stretches from Pensacola to Key West and includes some of Florida's award-winning state parks! Visit 20 caches and win the Official Operation Recreation Geocoin.
Program
The Outsiders Club
"The Outsiders Club" is an exciting 30-minute program starring kids who explore Florida State Parks and model ways to pursue a healthier, more active, nature-connected lifestyle, featuring camping, fishing, kayaking and hiking.

Girl Scouts Love State Parks Nature Bingo
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Saturday, September 13, 2025 9:00 am - 3:00 pm EDT
Where
Gamble Rogers Memorial State Recreation Area At Flagler Beach
3100 S Oceanshore Blvd.
Flagler Beach  FL 32164
Fees
Regular park entrance fee applies:
$5.00 per vehicle — limit 2-8 people per vehicle
$4.00 per single-occupant vehicle
$2.00 per pedestrians, bicyclists, extra passengers, passengers in vehicle with holder of Annual Individual Entrance Pass.
Description
Girls Scouts Love State Parks Get Wild with Nature Bingo!
Ready to turn your next walk in the park into an outdoor adventure? Grab a Nature Bingo card and set off on a scavenger hunt through the great outdoors! Spot a squirrel? See a wildflower? Catch a creepy-crawly in action? Mark it on your card! Your mission: find five nature items in a row—across, down, or diagonally—to win!  Bring your winning card to the Ranger Station to claim a cool prize! But hurry—only the first 30 nature explorers will score one. Pick up your Nature Bingo card at the Ranger Station and let the adventure begin. It's fun, it's free, and it's the perfect way to explore the wonders of the park! Let's see how wild your bingo skills really are!
Contact
stephanie.york@floridadep.gov

Eternal Horizons: Death And The Afterlife In Ancient Egypt
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Friday, September 12, 2025 10:30 am - 12:00 pm EDT
Where
Koreshan State Park
3800 CORKSCREW RD
Estero  FL 33928
Directions
Art Hall in the Historic Settlement
Fees
Program is free with paid park admission fee. Free for Florida State Park Pass holders.
Description
Join the historian of Koreshan State Park for a fascinating journey into the beliefs and practices surrounding death and the afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Discover the mysteries of tombs, mummies, and burial goods at this unique event. Learn about the rituals and customs that the ancient Egyptians followed to ensure a successful journey to the afterlife. Don't miss this opportunity to delve into the fascinating world of one of history's most intriguing civilizations!
Contact
robert.g.hughes@floridadep.gov

An Evening Under The Stars
Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools
When
Saturday, September 13, 2025 6:45 pm - 11:00 pm CDT
Where
Big Lagoon State Park
12301 Gulf Beach Highway
Pensacola  FL 32507
Directions
Telescopes set up on far SE side of the Amphitheater parking area
Fees
The gazes themselves are free; however normal park entry fees do apply. $4 for one person or $6 for up to 8 people in a vehicle.
Description
Big Lagoon State Park along with the Escambia Amateur Astronomer Association would like to invite you to spend an evening gazing at the skies! Clear skies permitting, members of the Association will set up telescopes and binoculars to capture views of the moon, planets, and other celestial objects. The gaze will be held at the Amphitheater, telescopes will be set up on the SE side of the parking area. Please park on the north side of the lot to minimize light pollution and disturbance when coming and going. All participants MUST have entered the park prior to closing time; which is sunset, this time varies throughout the year. The front gates will be locked at that time, and visitors will NOT be permitted to enter the park after closing time. The gazes themselves are free; however normal park entry fees do apply. NOTE: as sunset times do change throughout the year, please contact the Ranger Station at (850) 492-1595 ahead of time to find out when the front gates will be locking for the evening Event dates: September 13, October 11
Contact
emily.price@floridadep.gov
